intro: Achillea coarctata, commonly known as narrowleaf yarrow, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring basal leaves that are narrow and linear. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow, appearing in flat-topped clusters. Achillea coarctata is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to harsh, alpine environments.
